sentence.Network_en: Where there is triviality, there is sin and animality.
sentence.Network_cn: 有薄浅狭隘的地方, 就有罪恶与兽性.

sentence.Network_en: He never liked that woman and he begot his children in mere animality.
sentence.Network_cn: 他从不喜欢那个女人,他生孩子仅是基于肉欲.

sentence.Network_en: I am repulsed by the animality of the body, by its dirt and decay.
sentence.Network_cn: 我被我身体里的兽性 、 被这种兽性的肮脏腐烂击败了.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from French animalité, from animal (adjective), from Latin animalis 'animate, living' (see animal)

means.word_mean: 1. the physical (or animal) side of a person as opposed to the spirit or intellect

auth_sentence.content: Most of life' decisions are coloured by our social animality.
auth_sentence.res_content: Most of life' decisions are coloured by our social animality.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Most of life' decisions are coloured by our social animality.

auth_sentence.content: England, however, animality aside, was through to the semifinals, without conceding a single goal.
auth_sentence.res_content: England, however, animality aside, was through to the semifinals, without conceding a single goal.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: England, however, animality aside, was through to the semifinals, without conceding a single goal.

auth_sentence.content: Even those of Linnaeus's contemporaries who conceded the animality of man averred that people have two feet, not four.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even those of Linnaeus's contemporaries who conceded the animality of man averred that people have two feet, not four.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even those of Linnaeus's contemporaries who conceded the animality of man averred that people have two feet, not four.
